intro: Manihot kalungae, commonly known as the Congo arrowleaf, is a perennial shrub native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
